data.title: Informative history of Plantation
data.text: This is a small local museum dedicated to the history of Plantation. They do have some other exhibits at certain times of the year.

data.title: Local gem
data.text:
Tuck away in back of the Plantation Library, most people don't even know this little museum exists. Which is a pity because it is great. Tiny but with ever changing exhibits that are tied to the city in some fashion. 
Xmas tree displays, historical city pics and equipment; wwII from eyes of local vets. 
Always interesting and FREE.

data.title: A True Local Treasure
data.text: We discovered this museum after having living and working  in Plantation for years once we visited the adjacent private Helen B. Hoffman Library. We always enjoy the extensive and impressive Christmas displays each Holiday Season. We also attended the fun new exhibit: "The Pirates: Treasure, Terror & Tall Tales" which had it's official opening this past Saturday, June 4, 2016 and will be at the Museum through Oct. 22, 2016. The festive opening included a Pirate enactment of sword fighting and a dance troop of Pirate Lasses: The Red Flag Pirates who delighted the adults and children alike. Kudos to all affiliated with this Museum and their ongoing recording of local history.

data.title: Free Admission
data.text:
The museum has new exhibits several times during the year.  Currently showing:
Everglades Diorama showing the “Many Faces of the Everglades”
History of City of Plantation exhibit
Fire Dept. memorabilia including the City’s first fire engine
Artwork by Kevin Wakefield
Ice Age exhibit featuring bones & fossils from Florida
Cheryl the Triceratops, dinosaur skeleton
Seminole and Tequesta display

data.title: Beautiful place, wonderful decorations, art
data.text: Go every year around Christmas, they have so many beautiful Christmas Trees, each decorated differently, beautiful porcelain dolls, lovely art exhibits to!

data.title: Monthly meeting presentation
data.text:
I was invited to give a presentation about the History of NAS Fort Lauderdale Museum,  Meeting was well attended, attendees were interested in my presentation and asked pertinent questions.
Museum was very interesting and well organized.

data.title: Wonderful Christmas Exhibits
data.text: What a great historical museum, a must visit, a definite gem.  Visited during the holiday season with my daughter, her friend, two of my grandchildren and three other toddlers.There were at least a dozen wonderful Christmas theme trees, including traditional, patriotic and various other themes.  There were artifacts from the Seminole and Tequesta tribes, There was a mounted dinasaur skeleton, a saber toot cat skeleton and much more.  There was a great Firefighter Exhibit. There was something of interest for everyone.  It was a compendium of South Florida history.  The Library and Museum are amidst the Botanical Gardens Park, a meandering and beautiful setting.  They have a Butterfly Garden but we didn't know it at the time.  The staff was knowledgeable and very friendly and welcoming. Finally, there was no admission charge but donations are most appreciated.

data.title: Great museum
data.text: You will enjoy the museum as well as the nearby park. The museum has a great fireman display. Different times of the year has different attractions

data.title: This Place is a Must Visit
data.text:
We were only able to get 15 minutes of this place, but wish we had an hour. There were war pieces, a mounted dinosaur skeleton, a saber tooth cat skeleton and lots more. The best part about this place though was the friendliness of the persons who guide you through it. They are very welcoming and kind.

Everyone near plantation should make it a point of duty to visit there.

data.title: Definitely a gem
data.text: You must visit the Plantation Historical Museum. From Dinosaurs to modern day there is something of interest for the whole family. The staff is very gracious and knowledgeable, and ready to give you a tour or answer questions. We were there during a dinosaur exhibition and it was very informative. The Museum is not just Plantation history, but a compendium of South Fla. history. It was also free, so that's a pretty good deal.

data.title: Holiday Happiness
data.text: Great holiday display of trees.  Other times in the year, there are different themes.  Curators are very friendly and full of information.

data.title: one of the best places to see in Ft lauderdale
data.text: This is one of the best museum's with great Imax screen.  i love it and love to visit again with my daughter and family.

data.title: Nice Little Museum
data.text: While visiting family we stopped by the museum which was down the road from the house. The staff was friendly and there was a model train show going on. We all enjoyed the train show as well as  the displays through out the museum. The rating would be higher if there was more to do, but with its limited space, the museum had enough displays with informative information.

data.title: Museum with character
data.text: The museum is not your typical one.  It has a dinosaur along with its newest attraction with the feel and life of the Everglades which is interactive.  They have the original fire truck of the city of Plantation as well as life of the early Seminole Indians.  It has some hands on exhibits and it changes the exhibits several times during the year.  The best part of spending a few hours touring it is that it is free.  You can call ahead for guided tour groups and it is especially geared to children.  At Christmas time they exhibit 40 plus trees.  This summer they are showing electric trains.

data.title: good museum.. interesting exhibits
data.text: always have good exhibits..which change every few months.. as well as some permanent displays.. docents very knowledgeable.. takes anywhere from half hour to hour to see everything..the Christmas display there is awesome and fun for both kids as well as adults..check it out!

data.title: Plantation Museum for Christmas
data.text: My family and I went to the Plantation Museum prior to Christmas we loved it. I have a 20 yr old 16 year old and 13 year old. They had very nice small homemade gifts to purchase plus all different themed decorated trees. the night we went they had a presentation by the bell choir with cookies and refreshments. It was wonderful. Staff was pleasant and my kids asked that we see what was happening next year.

data.title: FOME
data.text:
Es una total perdida de tiempo en el caso que no te gusten las antiguedades.
Para el destino no es unja opcion muy viable, sobre todo si viajas con niños debido a que se van a aburrir

data.title: Pouco interessante
data.text: É um local com poucas atrações. Parei para ver com minha esposa e em cerca de 2 horas já tinhamos visto tudo e não vi nada que me interessasse de fato com os que visitei em nova york, washington, entre outros. não recomendo.

data.title: Excelente!
data.text: Adoramos o museu! Muito interessante e completo, vale a pena dar um pulinho com a família se tiver um tempo sobrando.
